text:
Use org.apache.poi.hwpf.usermodel.Range.getParagraph method ,will throw ArrayOutOfBound exception in org.apache.poi.hwpf.model.StyleSheet.getParagraphStyle  at line 325 ,
and org.apache.poi.hwpf.model.StyleSheet.getCharacterStyle  at line 315 ,
creator: kyowxf2003@163.com

text:
Created attachment 26746
Judge the array index
creator: kyowxf2003@163.com
vlsergey@gmail.com
text:
Wang,

Could you provide a doc file (test case) that gives an error because of ArrayOutOfBoundException?

Sergey

creator: trejkaz@trypticon.org
text:
A customer of ours has found a file which throws this error as well, and it's another case where the file contains confidential information so we can't attach it. :(

It's unclear to me whether this is a bug in POI or an issue with the file itself (if it's the latter then the issue on our end can be closed without fixing anything.) Essentially there is an index stored in the file which refers to an array element which doesn't actually exist, which smells like an issue with the file.

Does someone know the specification well enough to make a call on this?

This is the best I can find from the docs:

"If an istd value refers to an empty or nonexistent style, or to a style of a different type, a later Prl such as sprmPIstd or sprmPIstdPermute MUST change the istd to a valid value. Applying an istd that refers to an empty or nonexistent style, or to a style of a different type, is equivalent to applying the paragraph and character document default formatting (while preserving the same set of properties as when applying an istd.)"

This does appear to be what the change is doing, it just didn't give a reference to the docs so it wasn't very clear.
creator: trejkaz@trypticon.org

text: Can you try running the Binary File Format Validator from Microsoft against the troublesome file, and see if that says it's valid or not?
creator: apache@gagravarr.org
dominik.stadler@gmx.at
text: No response on this issue for a long time and without a sample document we cannot really reproduce this and thus not implement a fix if this is still an issue. Therefore I am closing this WONTFIX for now, please reopen this issue if you see this problem and can provide a sample file and sample code to reproduce it.
